wikipedia_page.main: Neil Munro (25 January 1868 – 4 September 1948) was a Scottish footballer who played for Abercorn and Scotland.

response: * 25 January – Neil Munro (d. 1948), Scotland international in two matches, scoring two goals (1888–1889).
* John Neil Munro (born 1959), Scottish author and journalist
* Neil Munro (actor) (1947–2009), Canadian actor, director and playwright
* Neil Munro (writer) (1863–1930), Scottish author who sometimes used pen name Hugh Foulis

Neil Munro is the name of:
* Neil Munro (actor) (1947–2009), Scottish-born Canadian director, actor and playwright
* Neil Munro (writer) (1863–1930), Scottish journalist, newspaper editor, author and literary critic
* Neil Munro (footballer) (1868–1948), Scottish footballer who played for Abercorn and Scotland
* John Neil Munro, author of The Sensational Alex Harvey and Some People Are Crazy — The John Martyn Story
* Neil Munro Roger, see Bunny Roger
